verbs.description: speechify (third-person singular simple present speechifies, present participle speechifying, simple past and past participle speechified)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To give a speech; to hold forth; (now especially) to pronounce pompously or at length.
examples: He never missed a chance of speechifying in public.

entries.meaning: (transitive, possibly obsolete) To make speeches to (someone); to address in a speech.
examples: They take their little enjoyments on little means and with little things and don't let solemn big-wigs stare them out of countenance or speechify them dull.
